intro: Rudgea mouririoides, commonly known as the Brazilian wax tree, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
